    Yard, Rear. "Rear yard" means an open space extending along the full length of the rear lot line between the side lot line and extending from the rear lot line to the rear of the principal building or projection thereof. 
    Yard, Side. "Side yard" means an open space extending along a side lot line from the front lot line to the rear lot line extending from the side lot line to the side of the principal building or projection thereof. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003; Ord. 822, 1998; Ord. 818 (part), 1997; Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 933, 3-7-16; Ord. No. 941, 8-1-16; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16; Ord. No. 950, 12-18-17; Ord. No. 954, 5-21-18) 
Chapter 17.12 - DISTRICT BOUNDARIES AND MAP 

17.12.010 - Districts established. 
    In order to carry out the purposes and provisions of these regulations, the following zoning districts are established: 
17.16 R-SF Single-family residential district 17.20 R-LD Low-density residential district 17.24 R-MD Medium-density residential district 17.28 R-HD High-density multiple family residential district 17.32 R-MHP Planned mobilehome park district 17.36 R-MFH Manufactured home residential district 17.38 R-SU Suburban single-family residential district 17.40 C-NGH Neighborhood commercial district 17.44 C-CAC Central area commercial district 17.48 C-HWY Highway commercial district 17.52 I-LT Limited industrial district 17.56 I-HVY Heavy industrial district 17.60 PUD Planned urban district 17.64 AG Agricultural district 17.68 FP Floodplain district 17.72 PUB Public facilities district  
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.12.020 - District map established. 
A.  Zoning Districts. The location and boundaries of the zoning districts are hereby established as shown on the zoning district map on file in the office of the code administrator. The zoning district maps, together with all information shown thereon and all amendments thereto, shall be an integral part of these regulations. 
B.  Public Street as Boundary. Where zoning district boundary lines are indicated as following streets or alleys, or extension thereof, such boundary line shall be construed to be the center line of said streets or alleys or extension thereof unless clearly shown to the contrary. 
C.  Lot Line as Boundary. Where a zoning district boundary line coincides approximately but not exactly with a lot line, the zoning boundary shall be construed to be the lot line at that location. 
D.  District Description for Unsubdivided Lands. For unsubdivided property, zoning district boundaries are determined by metes and bounds description or by legal description as deemed necessary. 
(Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.12.030 - Vacated areas. 
    Where a public way is vacated by the official action of the board of city commissioners, the zoning district boundaries shall be extended to the center of the vacated public way. 
(Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.12.040 - Annexation of land. 
    Any newly-annexed area shall be placed in AG agricultural district, unless the area is targeted and scheduled for development, in which case the area shall be placed in the appropriate zoning district subject to the zoning district changes and zoning district amendments provided in these regulations. 
(Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.12.050 - Zoning district boundary interpretation. 
    Where any uncertainty exists as to the exact location of the zoning district boundary lines, the Planning Commission shall determine the location of such boundary lines. 
(Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
17.12.060 - Certification of map. 
    The official map shall bear the date of adoption of the zoning map as an integral part of these regulations. 
(Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
Chapter 17.16 - R-SF SINGLE-FAMILY RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.16.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-SF single-family residential district is primarily established to promote a suitable residential environment and to accommodate low-density detached single-family residential units uninterrupted by conflicting uses and incompatible activities. For the R-SF single-family residential district, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction or placement of, and the continued use of the land for single-family dwellings in the city and extraterritorial area; 
B.  To prohibit high-density residential, commercial and industrial use of the land to prohibit any other use which would substantially interfere with development or continuation of single-family dwellings in the district; 
C.  To discourage any use which would generate traffic on minor streets other than normal traffic to serve residents on those streets. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family detached dwelling units; 
B.  Neighborhood playgrounds and open spaces; 
C.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
D.  Home occupation; 
E.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.16.030 - Conditional uses. 
    Public facilities such as public library, parks, golf courses except miniature courses or driving ranges operated for commercial purposes. 
A.  Public and private schools; 
B.  Churches, cemeteries and related uses; 
C.  Colleges and universities; 
D.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
E.  Fire stations; 
F.  Water reservoirs, water storage tanks, water pumping stations and sewer lift stations. 
G.  Attached and detached accessory dwelling units as provided in Section 17.76.130. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16) 
17.16.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and accessory buildings shall not exceed thirty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  A lot shall contain no less than eight thousand square feet of area per dwelling unit in the city limits and sixteen thousand square feet of area per dwelling unit in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum lot width shall be no less than sixty-five feet. 
(Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet on local streets and fifty feet for collector and arterial streets. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be no less than eight feet on each side of a lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.070 - Building height. 
    No building shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces provided for each residential dwelling unit. 
B.  The parking need for the conditionally permitted uses shall be subject to the requirements of Section 17.76.020. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.16.090 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per residential dwelling structure not exceeding two square feet in area. The sign may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but it shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs including "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.20 - R-LD LOW-DENSITY RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.20.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-LD low-density residential district is primarily established to promote a suitable residential environment and to accommodate low-density residential uses largely consisting of single-family detached dwelling units and two-family dwelling units uninterrupted by conflicting uses and incompatible activities. For the R-LD low-density residential district, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction or placement of, and the continued use of the land for single-family dwellings in the city and extraterritorial area; 
B.  To prohibit high-density residential, commercial and industrial use of the land and to prohibit any other use which would substantially interfere with development or continuation of single-family dwellings in the district; 
C.  To discourage any use which would generate traffic on minor streets other than normal traffic to serve residents on those streets; 
D.  To discourage any use which because of its character or size would create requirements and costs for public services such as water supply and sewerage, substantially in excess of such requirements and costs if the districts were developed solely for single-family and two-family dwellings. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family detached dwellings units; 
B.  Two-family dwelling units; 
C.  Neighborhood playgrounds and open spaces; 
D.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
E.  Home occupation; 
F.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.20.030 - Conditional uses. 
    Public facilities such as public library, parks, golf courses except miniature courses or driving ranges operated for commercial purposes. 
A.  Public and private schools; 
B.  Churches, cemeteries and related uses; 
C.  Colleges and universities; 
D.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
E.  Fire stations; 
F.  Water reservoirs, water storage tanks, water pumping stations and sewer lift stations. 
G.  Attached and detached accessory dwelling units as provided in Section 17.76.130. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16) 
17.20.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and accessory buildings shall not exceed thirty-five percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  A lot shall contain no less than seven thousand square feet of area per dwelling unit in the city limits and fourteen thousand square feet of area per dwelling unit in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum lot area for duplexes shall be ten thousand square feet in the city limits and twenty thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
C.  The minimum lot width shall be no less than fifty feet. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet on local streets and fifty feet for collector and arterial streets. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be no less than eight feet on each side of a lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.070 - Building height. 
    No building shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces provided for each residential dwelling unit. 
B.  The parking need for the conditionally permitted uses shall be subject to the requirements of Section 17.76.020. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.20.090 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per residential dwelling unit not exceeding two square feet in area, or there shall be no more than one identification sign for structures with more than four dwelling units not exceeding thirty-six square feet in area. The sign may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but it shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs including "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.24 - R-MD MEDIUM-DENSITY RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ords. 788 and 818. 

17.24.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-MD medium-density residential district is primarily established to promote a suitable residential environment and to accommodate town houses and apartments of medium density to meet the needs of various income or age groups in the city. For the R-MD medium-density residential district, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction or placement of, and the continued use of the land for residential purposes on urban lots; 
B.  To prohibit high density residential, and industrial use of the land and to prohibit any other use which would substantially interfere with development or continuation of single-family dwellings in the district; 
C.  To discourage any use which because of its character or size would generate traffic or require municipal services substantially in excess of traffic and services that would exist if the district were developed solely for multifamily dwellings. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family detached dwelling units; 
B.  Two-family dwelling units; 
C.  Multiple-family attached dwelling units, including townhouses, garden apartments and multiple-dwelling unit structures not exceeding eight dwelling units in a structure; 
D.  Neighborhood playgrounds and open spaces; 
E.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
F.  Home occupation; 
G.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.24.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Churches, cemeteries and related uses; 
B.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
C.  Public and private schools; 
D.  Public facilities such as parks, golf courses except miniature golf courses and driving ranges operated for profit; 
E.  Parking lots; 
F.  Public or private utility structures; 
G.  Hospitals and clinics; 
H.  Colleges and universities; 
I.  Municipal facilities such as fire stations, city hall, police stations and museums; 
J.  Bed and breakfast establishments. 
K.  Attached and detached accessory dwelling units as provided in Section 17.76.130. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16) 
17.24.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and all accessory buildings shall not exceed fifty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum lot area for each multifamily dwelling unit in the city shall be three thousand five hundred square feet area. The minimum lot area in the extraterritorial planning area shall be seven thousand square feet per dwelling unit. 
B.  For single-family dwelling units, the minimum lot area shall be seven thousand square feet in the city and fourteen thousand square feet in the extraterritorial area. The minimum lot area for duplexes shall be ten thousand square feet in the city limits and twenty thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
C.  For multiple-family uses the minimum lot width shall be sixty five feet. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet on local streets and fifty feet for collector and arterial streets. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be no less than eight feet on each side of a lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.070 - Building height. 
A.  No building shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high. 
B.  Nonresidential buildings permitted as conditional uses shall not be more than three stories high excepting church steeples and other similar structural elements. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces provided for each residential dwelling unit. 
B.  The parking need for the conditionally permitted uses shall be subject to the requirements of Chapter 17.52. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.24.090 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per residential dwelling unit not exceeding two square feet in area, or there shall be no more than one identification sign for structures with more than four dwelling units not exceeding thirty-six square feet in area. The sign may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but it shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs including "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.28 - R-HD HIGH-DENSITY MULTIPLE-FAMILY RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.28.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-HD high-density multiple-family district is primarily established to promote a suitable residential environment and to accommodate high-density residential district to meet the needs of various income and age groups. For the R-HD, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction of and the continued use of the land for residential purposes; 
B.  To prohibit commercial and industrial use of the land and to prohibit any other use which would substantially interfere with the development or continuation of residential structures in this district; 
C.  To discourage any use which because of its character or size would create requirements and cost for public services, such as water supply and sewerage substantially in excess of such requirements if the district were developed solely for multifamily dwellings and limited business development. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family dwelling units; 
B.  Two-family dwelling units; 
C.  Multiple-family dwelling units; 
D.  Home occupation; 
E.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
F.  Parks and playgrounds; 
G.  Parking lots; 
H.  Municipal facilities such as City Hall, fire station, police station, library, and museum; 
I.  Parks and open spaces, including golf courses and outdoor sports facilities; 
J.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.28.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Colleges and universities; 
B.  Churches and cemeteries; 
C.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
D.  Nursing homes; 
E.  Public and private schools; 
F.  Group homes, group quarters, lodging houses and rooming houses; 
G.  Professional offices; 
H.  Private clubs and fraternal organizations including residential uses for caretaker or custodian; 
I.  Bed and breakfast establishments; 
J.  Clinics and hospitals. 
K.  Emergency medical air transport services with supporting structures, i.e. hangers, landing pads, etc. 
L.  Attached and detached accessory dwelling units as provided in Section 17.76.130. 
(Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 941, 8-1-16; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16) 
17.28.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal building and all accessory buildings shall not exceed sixty percent of the total lot area. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  A minimum lot area for each dwelling unit in a multiple-family structure of nine or more units in the city shall be two thousand five hundred square feet. The minimum lot area for each dwelling unit in the extraterritorial planning area shall be five thousand square feet. For multiple-family structures of eight or less units the minimum lot area per dwelling unit shall be three thousand five hundred square feet in the city limits and seven thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum lot area for a single-family unit shall be seven thousand square feet in the city limits and fourteen thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. The minimum lot area for duplexes shall be ten thousand square feet in the city limits and twenty thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet on local streets and fifty feet for collector and arterial streets. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be ten feet. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.070 - Building height. 
A.  No residential building shall be more than three stories or forty-five feet high. 
B.  Nonresidential buildings shall be no more than four stories or forty-five feet high excepting church steeples and similar structural elements. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be no less than two off-street parking spaces for each residential dwelling unit. For efficiency apartments there shall be at least one space per dwelling unit. 
B.  There shall be no less than one off-street parking space for each ten beds in the nursing homes and group homes. 
C.  For nonresidential uses the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.28.090 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per residential dwelling unit not exceeding two square feet in area, or there shall be no more than one identification sign for structures with more than four dwelling units not exceeding thirty-six square feet. The sign may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but it shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs including "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.32 - R-MHP PLANNED MOBILE HOME PARK DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.32.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-MHP planned mobile home park district is primarily established to promote a suitable mobile home rental spaces for permanent occupancy or for recreational uses. The placement of mobile homes shall meet the requirements of the City Code. A building permit is required for any unit added in the park. For the R-MHP planned mobile home park district, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To prohibit commercial and industrial uses of the land; 
B.  To encourage suitable and proper development of mobile home parks. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-wide mobile homes; 
B.  Double-wide manufactured homes set on temporary foundation; 
C.  Accessory buildings such as garages and storage buildings; 
D.  Neighborhood parks and playgrounds; 
E.  Home occupation; 
F.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children; 
G.  Recreational vehicles. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.32.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Churches and places of worship; 
B.  Public utilities and structures; 
C.  Schools; 
D.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.32.040 - Site plan. 
    A site plan prepared by a registered engineer, architect or a qualified planner is required to include the following: 
A.  Topographical map showing the original and final contours; 
B.  Proposed storm water drainage system; 
C.  Layout of lots, block, street and walkway systems including the location of entrances and exits to and from the park; 
D.  Location and capacity of water and sanitary sewer systems including distribution and collection systems; 
E.  Park and playground areas and location of the park service buildings; 
F.  Fencing and screen planting; 
G.  Provision for garbage collection; 
H.  Statement of conformance with the Federal Housing Administration's Minimum Property Standards for Mobile Home Courts. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.050 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and accessory buildings shall not exceed thirty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 856 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.060 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum park area shall be no less than two acres. 
B.  The minimum lot area for each rental site shall be five thousand square feet for single-wide mobile home and seven thousand square feet for double-wide manufactured home. Each lot shall directly front on a roadway. 
C.  The minimum lot width for each rental site shall be forty feet for single-wide mobile home and fifty feet for double-wide mobile home. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.070 - Yard requirements. 
    For determining the yard requirements in this district the placement of the unit shall be considered regardless of the entrance to the unit. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front property line on public rights-of-way shall be twenty feet. This distance is to be measured from the property line. 
B.  The minimum rear yard from a mobile home park's exterior property lines shall be fifteen feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard for units, additions, sheds and garages abutting public rights-of-way or a mobile home park's exterior property lines shall be ten feet. For interior lots the minimum distance between the units and any additions shall be twenty feet. 
D.  Detached garages and sheds shall be a minimum five feet from the unit and a minimum ten feet from an adjacent unit and five feet from a neighboring accessory structure. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 900, 4-16-12) 
17.32.080 - Building height. 
    No building or structure shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.090 - R-MHP Mobile home park requirement. 
A.  Roadways within the parks shall be hard-surfaced, either concrete or bituminized. 
B.  All provisions for water supply, laundry, sewage and fire protection to be provided in any R-MHP district shall have been approved by the appropriate city department and shall meet city service standards. 
C.  Recreation area shall be provided within each mobile home park for the exclusive use of the park occupants. Such recreation site or sites shall have a minimum area of six percent of the lot area. 
D.  All mobile home parks shall have near their main entrance, a park office in which there shall be an up-to-date list of park residents along with their address and a diagram of the park layout. 
E.  Each mobile home shall be anchored to the ground for purposes of withstanding wind pressures specified for such mobile/manufactured homes prior to occupancy of the unit. 
F.  Existing R-MHP shall not be enlarged or extensively altered unless such alteration complies with the provisions of this article. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 900, 4-16-12) 
17.32.100 - Parking. 
    There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces for each dwelling unit. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.32.110 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per mobile/manufactured home unit exceeding two square feet in area. 
B.  The location and size of identification signs for the manufactured home park shall be approved by the code administrator but in no event the size of the sign shall exceed forty square feet. Signs may be wall, pedestal, ground or projection type but shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
C.  Temporary signs such as "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
Chapter 17.36 - R-MFH MANUFACTURED HOME RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.36.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-MFH manufactured home residential district is primarily established to promote a suitable and affordable residential housing environment and to accommodate site-built, detached, single-family dwelling units and manufactured home units on sites owned individually. A building permit is required for any unit added in the district. For the R-MFH residential district, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction or placement of single-family homes and the continued use of land for single-family residential purposes; 
B.  To prohibit commercial and industrial uses of the land. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family residential dwelling units; 
B.  Manufactured home units with a minimum overall front width of twenty-four feet, minimum overall depth of twenty feet, and minimum main floor living space square footage of nine hundred square feet; 
C.  Neighborhood playgrounds and open spaces; 
D.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
E.  Home occupation; 
F.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.36.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Public facilities such as public library, parks, golf courses except miniature courses or public driving ranges operated for commercial purposes; 
B.  Public and private schools; 
C.  Churches, cemeteries and related uses; 
D.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
E.  Public and private utilities and structures; 
F.  Fire stations; 
G.  Water reservoirs, water storage tanks, water pumping stations and sewer lift stations. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.36.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and accessory buildings shall not exceed thirty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 856 (part), 2003: Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum area for each lot shall be no less than eight thousand square feet in the city limits and sixteen thousand square feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum lot width shall be sixty-five feet. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be twenty feet in the city and fifty feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be eight feet on each side of a lot. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.070 - Building height. 
    No building shall be higher than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high, except church steeples and similar structural elements. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces per dwelling unit. 
B.  For nonresidential uses the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.090 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per dwelling unit not exceeding two square feet in area. Signs may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs such as "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
17.36.100 - Special provisions. 
    The code administrator shall have the authority to approve the provisions of this section. 
A.  All manufactured dwelling units shall be covered with an exterior material used in conventional dwelling units. The exterior covering shall extend to the ground, except when a solid concrete or masonry perimeter foundation is used, the exterior covering material need not extend below the top of the foundation. 
B.  All manufactured dwelling units shall have a roof with a pitch of not less than two and one-half inches vertical rise for each twelve inches of horizontal run and consisting of shingles or other material customarily used for conventional dwelling units. 
C.  For compatibility with the surrounding dwelling units, the manufactured dwelling units may be required to have porches and eaves and roofs with eaves. 
D.  A manufactured dwelling unit shall be subject to all provisions of these regulations except that it shall be constructed according to the specifications of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.36.110 - Foundation requirements. 
    Foundations for manufactured homes must be installed according to the manufacturer's recommendations. 
(Ord. 834 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.38 - R-SU SUBURBAN SINGLE-FAMILY RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT 

17.38.010 - Purpose. 
    The R-SU suburban single-family residential district is primarily established to promote a suitable residential environment and to accommodate low density, large lot, limited agriculture, and limited equine husbandry. For the R-SU suburban single-family residential district, in promoting the general purposes of this title, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction or placement of, and the continued use of the land for single-family dwellings on large lots and for limited agricultural uses; 
B.  To prohibit general commercial and industrial uses of the land and to prohibit any use with the development or the continuation of single-family dwellings and limited agricultural uses; 
C.  To discourage any use which would generate traffic on the streets of the district other than normal traffic to serve the suburban single-family residences of the area. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.38.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family detached dwelling units; 
B.  Manufactured home units with a minimum overall front width of twenty-four feet, minimum overall depth of twenty feet, and minimum main floor living space square footage of nine hundred square feet; 
C.  Playgrounds and open spaces; 
D.  Accessory buildings and structures; 
E.  Family foster home for adults; 
F.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children; 
G.  Home occupation. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 937, 3-7-16) 
17.38.030 - Conditional uses. 
    Public facilities such as public library, parks, golf courses except miniature courses or driving ranges operated for commercial purposes. 
A.  Churches, cemeteries and related uses; 
B.  Colleges and universities; 
C.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children; 
D.  Fire stations; 
E.  Water reservoirs, water storage tanks, water pumping stations and sewer lift stations. 
F.  Keeping of animals as provided in Section 17.76.120 of this title. 
G.  Attached and detached accessory dwelling units as provided in Section 17.76.130. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13; Ord. No. 937, 3-7-16; Ord. No. 945, 12-5-16) 
17.38.040 - Density. 
    The maximum allowable density is one unit per acre. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
17.38.050 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal and accessory buildings shall not exceed thirty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.38.060 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  A subdivided platted lot shall contain no less than forty thousand square feet. A lot that is not divided and not platted must contain a minimum of four acres. 
B.  The minimum lot width shall be no less than one hundred feet. 
C.  The lot area for properties with an approved conditional use permit for the keeping of animals shall be a minimum of two acres. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 937, 3-7-16) 
17.38.070 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be no less than thirty feet on local streets and fifty feet for collector and arterial streets. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be no less than twenty feet on each side of a lot. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.38.080 - Building height. 
    No building shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.38.090 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces provided for each residential dwelling unit. 
B.  The parking need for the conditionally permitted uses shall be subject to the requirements of Section 17.76.020. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.38.100 - Signs. 
A.  There shall be no more than one identification sign per residential dwelling structure not exceeding two square feet in area. The sign may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but it shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  Temporary signs including "For Sale," "For Rent," political campaign signs, greeting signs and rally signs are permitted. 
C.  For nonresidential uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.40 - C-NGH NEIGHBORHOOD COMMERCIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ords. 788 and 818. 

17.40.010 - Purpose. 
    The C-NGH neighborhood commercial district is primarily established to accommodate basic shopping needs of a neighborhood largely consisting of residential uses. The commercial uses, however, shall not adversely affect the residential uses from the standpoint of noise, traffic, parking and convenience of the residents. For the C-NGH neighborhood commercial district, in promoting the general purpose of this article, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the continued use of the land for neighborhood commercial and service uses; 
B.  To prohibit heavy commercial and service uses and industrial uses of the land, and to prohibit any other use which would substantially depreciate the value of residential districts surrounding the C-NGH neighborhood commercial districts; 
C.  To encourage the discontinuance of mixed uses and uses that would not be permitted as new uses under the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Single-family and two family units; 
B.  Multiple-family dwelling units not exceeding the requirements of R-HD high density multifamily residential district; 
C.  Barber shops and beauty parlors; 
D.  Churches and religious buildings; 
E.  Home day-care facilities accommodating eighteen or less children; 
F.  Clinics and hospitals; 
G.  Fraternal organizations; 
H.  Gas stations and stop-and-go-type stores; 
I.  General retail stores; 
J.  Home occupations; 
K.  Libraries, museums, fire stations, police stations and City Hall; 
L.  Professional offices and businesses; 
M.  Retail uses and service compatible with the surrounding uses which will not adversely affect the residential properties. Such uses include taverns, liquor stores, laundry and dry cleaning establishments employing not more than five persons on the premises. 
N.  Accessory uses. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 895, 6-6-11; Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.40.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Automobile service stations and services employing more than five persons; 
B.  Public utility and service uses such as electric substations, railroad right-of-way, sanitary sewer lift stations, telephone exchange and water pumping stations; 
C.  Storage and processing of agricultural products; 
D.  Cable TV establishment including towers, dishes and major accessories. 
E.  Campgrounds. 
F.  Home day-care facilities accommodating more than eighteen children. 
(Ord. 837 (part), 2000: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 889, 8-2-10; Ord. No. 915, 8-5-13) 
17.40.040 - Lot coverage. 
A.  Commercial Use. The lot coverage of a commercial building and its accessory buildings shall not exceed seventy percent of the total lot area. In computing the lot coverage of a commercial building and its accessory buildings, sufficient area shall be added to its ground coverage for each off-street parking space as required by Section 17.76.020 of this title. 
B.  Residential Use. The ground area occupied by the principal building and all accessory buildings shall not exceed sixty percent of the total area. In computing the lot coverage, sufficient area shall be added to the actual area of the principal building and all accessory buildings to provide off-street parking spaces as required by Section 17.76.020 of this title if such spaces are not furnished within a building. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
    The minimum lot area for each multiple-family dwelling unit shall be the same as those required for R-HD multiple-family high density multiple-family residential district. 
A.  The minimum lot(s) area for neighborhood commercial uses shall be seven thousand square feet. In the event the commercial uses are located in the same structure as residential uses, there shall be additional two thousand five hundred square feet for each dwelling unit. 
B.  The minimum lot width shall be fifty feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall be eight feet on each side. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.070 - Building height. 
    No building or structure shall be more than three stories or forty-five feet high. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.080 - Parking. 
A.  There shall be a minimum of two off-street parking spaces per dwelling unit except for efficiency apartments for which there shall be one off-street parking space. 
B.  For commercial uses the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.40.090 - Signs. 
A.  For residential uses separate from the commercial uses there shall be not more than one identification sign per dwelling unit not exceeding two square feet in area. Signs may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
B.  For residential and commercial uses situated in the same building the commercial sign provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 895, 6-6-11)

17.44.060 - Parking. 
    For C-CAC district the parking provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
    Exemption: Parcels in this district which are part of the parking authority assessment district shall be subject to the requirements of and approval by the parking authority before a building permit for renovation, alteration or new construction is issued. 
(Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.44.070 - Signs. 
    For C-CAC district the sign provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
Chapter 17.48 - C-HWY HIGHWAY COMMERCIAL DISTRICT* 
Section: 

17.48.010 - Purpose. 
    The C-HWY highway commercial district is primarily established to accommodate those highway oriented commercial uses which by nature and operational characteristics such as direct access, large number of parking spaces, require separation from other uses because of the intensity and frequency of consumer travel. The C-HWY district is established to promote the general purpose of this chapter, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To provide an orderly and comprehensive expansion of commercial facilities without creating undue increased vehicular congestion in the C-HWY business district; 
B.  To encourage the regional commercial activities, and to protect and enhance property value of the commercial district through the provision of landscape and beautification of an individual commercial lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Accessory uses; 
B.  Advertising signs and billboards; 
C.  Amusement places such as bowling alleys, athletic clubs, pool halls, theaters, miniature golf courses and similar outdoor or indoor facilities; 
D.  Animal hospitals and kennels, including outdoor dog runs or exercise pens when located not less than two hundred feet from any residential district; 
E.  Bakeries and confectioneries; 
F.  Banks and financial institutions; 
G.  Battery and tire service establishments; 
H.  Building material and supply establishments; 
I.  Carpet and rug stores; 
J.  Catering businesses; 
K.  Churches and places of assembly; 
L.  Day care facilities; 
M.  Department stores; 
N.  Dry cleaning establishment and laundromats; 
O.  Express parcel delivery establishments; 
P.  Feed and seed stores; 
Q.  Frozen food lockers, but not slaughtering on the premises; 
R.  Fuel sales establishments; 
S.  Funeral homes; 
T.  Furniture and refinishing and upholstering; 
U.  Garages for repair and service of motor vehicles, including towing and wrecker service but not salvage operations; 
V.  Greenhouses; 
W.  Highway maintenance shops; 
X.  Hospitals and clinics; 
Y.  Machinery and equipment sales and service, including farm machinery and accessories; 
Z.  Marine vehicle sale and service; 
AA.  Meat product sales and locker rentals; 
BB.  Mobile home sales and services; 
CC.  Monument sales; 
DD.  Motels; 
EE.  Motor vehicle sales and rental; 
FF.  Offices; 
GG.  Office and supply stores and business machine sales and services; 
HH.  Packing and crating operations; 
II.  Plumbing shops and yards; 
JJ.  Radio, television, and electronic equipment sales and service; 
KK.  Restaurants, including all types of eating and drinking establishments; 
LL.  Shopping malls, including the retail services customarily accommodated therein; 
MM.  Sporting goods stores and bait shops; 
NN.  Taverns and liquor stores; 
OO.  Watchman and caretaker living areas. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.030 - Conditional uses. 
    Unless approved by the planning commission, conditional uses will not be located less than two hundred feet from a residential district. It is determined by the planning commission the conditional use will not be injurious to the surrounding premises or residential neighborhood, the planning commission may approve such conditional use or stipulate special conditions and restrictions as deemed necessary. 
A.  Animal rescue operations; 
B.  Contractors yard; 
C.  Machine shops and fabrication of metal products with less than ten employees; 
D.  Processing and packing of material with less than ten employees; 
E.  Radio and television stations and towers; 
F.  Fenced outdoor storage yards for vehicles with current license and registration, recreational vehicles, boats, ATVs, snowmobiles, trailers, equipment, and storage containers. 
G.  Storage garages and warehouses; 
H.  Campgrounds. 
I.  Medical marijuana dispensaries. Subject to Chapter 19-24.1 NDCC, Article 33-44 of the North Dakota Administrative Rules, and all other applicable laws and regulations. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 856 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 895, 6-6-11; Ord. No. 934, 3-7-16; Ord. No. 950, 12-18-17; Ord. No. 954, 5-21-18) 
17.48.040 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum lot area for C-HWY district shall be twenty thousand square feet for all properties adjacent to U.S. Highway 2, and seven thousand square feet for all other properties. 
B.  The minimum lot width for C-HWY district shall be one hundred feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.050 - Lot coverage. 
    The principal and accessory uses excluding parking shall not cover more than fifty percent of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front building line, measured from the front lot line, shall be fifty feet for all projects fronting U.S. Highway 2. For properties fronting on other streets the minimum front building line shall be twenty feet in the city and fifty feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
B.  The minimum rear building line, measured from the rear lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side building line, measured from the U.S. Highway 2 right-of-way shall be twenty-five feet and the minimum side yard for interior side of the lot shall be ten feet. The minimum side building line measured from other rights-of-way shall be ten feet in the city and twenty-five feet in the extraterritorial planning area. 
D.  The minimum front building line for stored items and storage buildings with outdoor storage areas with frontage on any right-of-way in the City of Devils Lake shall be two hundred fifty feet from that right-of-way. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 895, 6-6-11; Ord. No. 934, 3-7-16) 
17.48.070 - Landscape requirement. 
A.  A minimum of ten percent of the total plot area is recommended for landscaping purposes, and a minimum fifty percent of the ten percent landscape area is recommended to cover with a minimum of five gallon tree. 
B.  A landscape buffer yard of twenty feet is recommended when the adjacent property is residential. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.080 - Building height. 
    The building height requirement in C-HWY district shall be subject to the provisions of the airport ordinance. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.090 - Parking. 
A.  The front yard and the rear yard spaces may be used for parking. 
B.  For parking in C-HWY district the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.48.100 - Signs. 
    For signs in C-HWY district the provisions of Section 17.76.030 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.52 - I-LT LIMITED INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.52.010 - Purpose. 
    The I-LT limited industrial district is primarily established to accommodate light industrial facilities and to encourage grouping of industrial uses which due to their nature pose conflict with other adjoining uses. For I-LT industrial districts, in promoting the general purposes of this article, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the construction of and the continued use of the land for commercial and industrial buildings; 
B.  To prohibit the use of the land for heavy industrial or any other use which would substantially interfere with the development or continuation of commercial and industrial establishments in the district. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Accessory uses; 
B.  Agricultural chemical production and storage provided all operations are conducted entirely in enclosed buildings in order to contain fume, odor or other hazards; 
C.  Animal hospitals and kennels; 
D.  Any production, processing and treatment of products such as battery and tire service, dairy processing, bottling works, ice and cold storage plans, machine and sheet metal shops provided that all operations be conducted entirely in enclosed buildings; 
E.  Enclosed operations of building material and supply establishments; 
F.  Enclosed contractors yards and construction shops; 
G.  Feed and seed stores; 
H.  Frozen food lockers; 
I.  Electric power production and substations; 
J.  Fuel sales establishment including bottled gas; 
K.  Public utility buildings including water and waste water facilities and accessories; 
L.  Radar stations and towers; 
M.  Radio and television stations and studios; 
N.  Storage and warehousing establishments; 
O.  Storage yard but not salvage yards; 
P.  Watchman and caretaker living areas; 
Q.  Weighing stations; 
R.  Wholesaling establishments. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.030 - Conditional uses. 
A.  Animal rescue operations. 
B.  Airports and accessory facilities. 
C.  Medical marijuana manufacturing. Subject to Chapter 19-24.1 NDCC, Article 33-44 of the North Dakota Administrative Rules, and all other applicable laws and regulations. 
    Unless approved by the planning commission, conditional uses will not be located less than five hundred feet from a residential district. If it is determined by the planning commission the conditional use will not be injurious to the surrounding premises or residential neighborhood, the planning commission may approve such conditional use or stipulate special conditions and restrictions as deemed necessary. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 950, 12-18-17; Ord. No. 954, 5-21-18) 
17.52.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal building or buildings and accessory buildings excluding parking shall not exceed sixty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum lot area for I-LT district shall be twenty thousand square feet. 
B.  The minimum lot width for I-LT district shall be one hundred feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum setback, measured from any street right-of-way, shall be fifty feet. 
B.  The minimum rear building line, measured from the rear lot line, shall be twenty feet. 
C.  The minimum side building line, measured from the side lot line, shall be ten feet on each side of the lot. 
D.  No building or structure shall be located within two hundred feet of a residential district. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.070 - Landscape requirement. 
A.  A minimum of ten percent of the total plot area is recommended for landscaping purposes, and a minimum fifty percent of the ten percent landscape area is recommended to cover with a minimum of five gallon trees. 
B.  A landscape buffer yard of twenty feet is recommended when the adjacent property is residential. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.080 - Building height. 
    The building height requirement in I-LT district shall be subject to the provisions of the airport ordinance. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.090 - Parking. 
A.  For industrial uses, there shall be one off-street parking space for every two employees. 
B.  Additional spaces shall be provided to accommodate trucks and other motor vehicles. 
C.  For nonindustrial uses, the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.52.100 - Signs. 
    The sign requirements in I-LT district shall be subject to the provisions of Section 17.76.030. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.56 - I-HVY HEAVY INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () ---

17.56.010 - Purpose. 
    The I-HVY heavy industrial district is primarily established to accommodate industrial uses and facilities. It is planned to encourage grouping of related industrial uses for preventing intrusion on other uses to maintain an orderly, functional and efficient industrial land use system.

Any industrial or manufacturing operations provided that: (1) Dust, fumes, odors, smoke, vapor, noise, lights and vibration shall be confined within the I-HVY district, and (2) Outdoor storage, equipment and refuse areas shall be concealed from view from abutting rights-of-way and adjoining residential districts;

O.  Radio and television stations and studios;

If it is determined by the planning commission the conditional use will not be injurious to the surrounding premises or residential neighborhood, the planning commission may approve such conditional use or stipulate special conditions and restrictions as deemed necessary. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999)

17.56.040 - Lot coverage. 
    The ground area occupied by the principal building or buildings and accessory buildings excluding parking shall not exceed sixty percent of the total area of the lot. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.56.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The minimum lot area for I-HVY district shall be one acre. 
B.  The minimum lot width for I-HVY district shall be one hundred feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.56.060 - Yard requirements.

17.56.070 - Landscape requirement.

B.  A landscape buffer yard of twenty feet is recommended when the adjacent property is residential or commercial. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.56.080 - Building height. 
    The building height requirement in I-HVY district shall be subject to the provisions of the airport ordinance. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.56.090 - Parking. 
A.  For industrial uses there shall be one off-street parking space for every two employees. 
B.  Additional spaces shall be provided to accommodate trucks and other related motor vehicles. 
C.  For nonindustrial uses the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.56.100 - Signs. 
    The size and placement of the signs in I-HVY district shall be subject to the provisions of Section 17.76.030. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
Chapter 17.60 - PUD PLANNED UNIT DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT 

17.60.010 - Purpose. 
    The PUD planned unit development district is primarily established to encourage and promote environmental quality of Devils Lake by allowing for greater freedom, imagination and flexibility in the development of land while complying with the intent and purpose of the zoning regulations, other municipal codes and the city comprehensive plan. It is further the purpose of PUD district to encourage more rational, efficient and cost-effective development with relationship to public services while enhancing and improving the environmental quality of the area. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.60.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Any group of permitted uses in any zoning district in these regulations, provided that there is distinct compatibility and harmony among the uses, with no adverse effects on the adjoining use. 
B.  No use shall be permitted in the PUD district except in conformity with the city comprehensive plan and the precise development plan prepared to meet the requirement of this district. 
C.  In a PUD district the uses and their intensity, appearance and arrangement shall be of such visual and operational character which: (1) Are compatible with the physical nature of the site or area; (2) Would not adversely affect the provisions for public services; (3) Would not create a traffic or parking demand incompatible with the existing or proposed facilities. 
D.  The PUD district shall not adversely affect the economic prosperity of Devils Lake or its extraterritorial planning area. 
E.  The PUD district shall include assurances that the proposed plan would be completed in a manner that would not adversely affect the city or the area as a result of termination. The terms of the assurances shall address financial and development considerations in sufficient detail as may be required by the city. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.60.030 - Site requirements. 
A.  There shall be no predetermined requirements for lot area, lot width, building height and yards, but such requirements are made a part of an approved, recorded, and detailed development plan: 
B.  The minimum land parcel for PUD district shall be five acres. 
C.  In PUD district the location, number and configuration of parking spaces shall be a part of the detailed development plan. 
D.  In PUD district the location, type and size of signs shall be a part of the detailed development plan. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.60.040 - Development plan. 
A.  Where a development plan is required for a tract of land, the following shall be included in the plan: 
B.  Location of existing property lines, buildings, drives, streams, wooded areas and other significant natural features; 
C.  General layout of proposed streets and location of blocks for designated uses; 
D.  Location of open spaces and facilities for public uses; 
E.  Existing drainage pattern based on the available topographic information from the U.S. Geological Survey Maps and other similar information; 
F.  The development plan shall be drawn at a scale of one inch equaling four hundred feet; 
G.  The city planning commission may require other information as a part of the development plan. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.60.050 - Data submission requirements. 
A.  A general map of the area showing existing land use, zoning, street pattern and traffic data; 
B.  Detailed development plan showing: 
1.  Lot layout and street pattern, 
2.  Grading and storm water drainage plan, 
3.  Location of open spaces and recreational areas, 
4.  Location and description of any areas to be dedicated to the public; 
C.  Proof of financial capability; 
D.  Analysis of economic impacts; 
E.  Agreements, by-laws, provisions and covenants which insures the timely and satisfactory completion of the project without posing a burden on the city or adjoining properties. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
17.60.060 - Review and approval procedure. 
A.  The city planning commission shall review the proposed plan and it may require additional information and may require modification of the plan before it makes its recommendations to the board of city commissioners after a public hearing. 
B.  The board of city commissioners upon holding a public hearing may approve, deny or further modify the development plan. A developer's agreement spelling out all financial responsibilities of the developer and the city to be approved subsequently. 
C.  Upon approval of the board of city commissioners, the detailed development plan shall be recorded with the Ramsey County Register of deeds and the original plan be kept on file in the office of the code administrator. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999: Ord. 788 (part), 1994) 
Chapter 17.64 - AG AGRICULTURAL DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.64.010 - Purpose. 
    The AG agricultural district is primarily established to continue the agricultural uses customarily found on agricultural lands. The AG agricultural district is to serve as an interim step for change to an appropriate zoning district as the land becomes feasible for development. For an AG agriculture district, in promoting the general provisions of the ordinance codified in this chapter, the specific intent of this section is: 
A.  To encourage the continued use of land for agricultural use; 
B.  To prohibit scattered commercial and industrial use of land, and to prohibit any other use which would interfere with an integrated and efficient development of the land for more intensive urban uses as the city and townships in the extraterritorial area expands. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.020 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Accessory family buildings and uses; 
B.  General farming and dairying, including any uses incidental to farming; 
C.  Home occupation; 
D.  Manufactured home units with a minimum overall front width of twenty-four feet, minimum overall depth of twenty feet, and minimum main floor living space square footage of nine hundred square feet; 
E.  Single-family dwelling. 
(Ord. 879 (part), 2008: Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.030 - Conditional uses. 
    Conditional uses shall not be within five hundred feet of any residential district. 
A.  Churches and cemeteries; 
B.  Golf Courses; 
C.  Parks and playgrounds; 
D.  Public and private schools; 
E.  Stockpiling of sand and gravel for road construction and maintenance. Rock crushers, concrete and asphalt mixing plants, sand and gravel pits or any other such excavation shall comply with regulations as established by the engineering department; 
F.  Construction and maintenance of drainage systems to manage the water run-off; 
G.  Utility lines and pipes including substations for transformers, pumping stations and lift stations; 
H.  Water reservoirs and waste water treatment facilities; 
I.  Radio and television stations and towers; 
J.  Storage of agricultural products and chemicals including anhydrous ammonia storage tanks and fuel tanks for commercial purposes. 
K.  Fairgrounds. 
L.  Medical marijuana manufacturing. Subject to Chapter 19-24.1 NDCC, Article 33-44 of the North Dakota Administrative Rules, and all other applicable laws and regulations. 
    Unless approved by the planning commission, conditional uses will not be located less than five hundred feet from a residential district. If it is determined by the planning commission the conditional use will not be injurious to the surrounding premises or residential neighborhood, the planning commission may approve such conditional use or stipulate special conditions and restrictions as deemed necessary. 
(Ord. 856 (part), 2003: Ord. 853 (part), 2003: Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10; Ord. No. 954, 5-21-18) 
17.64.040 - Density. 
    One single-family dwelling shall be allowed for each tract of land not less than a quarter-quarter section in size provided that such tract shall contain at least thirty-five acres. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.050 - Lot area and lot width. 
A.  The lot area in AG district shall not be less than thirty-five acres. 
B.  The lot width in AG district shall not be less than three hundred feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.060 - Yard requirements. 
A.  The minimum front yard, measured from the front lot line, shall not be less than fifty feet. 
B.  The minimum rear yard, measured from the rear lot line, shall not be less than thirty feet. 
C.  The minimum side yard, measured from the side lot line, shall not be less than ten feet. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.070 - Building height. 
    The building height in AG district shall not exceed two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet except farm-related and communication structures. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.080 - Parking. 
    For nonfarm uses the provisions of Section 17.76.020 shall apply. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.64.090 - Signs. 
A.  Signs in AG agricultural district shall be no larger than twenty square feet in area for permitted uses. 
B.  Signs for conditional uses shall be no larger than thirty square feet in area. 
C.  Signs may be wall, pedestal, ground or projecting type but shall not project into the public right-of-way or public property. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
(Ord. No. 887, 7-6-10) 
Chapter 17.68 - FP FLOODPLAIN DISTRICT*[] 

Footnotes: 
--- () --- 
* Prior ordinance history: Ord. 788. 

17.68.010 - Applicability of chapter. 
    The FP floodplain district consists of the lands which have been or may be covered by flood water as delineated on the maps for the city of Devils Lake and the Township of Creel, in Ramsey County prepared by the Federal Emergency Management Agency for administration of the National Flood Insurance Program or other maps and information provided by the state of North Dakota. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.68.020 - Purpose. 
    The FP floodplain district is primarily established to designate those areas which need to accommodate the run-off water and to protect the public and private property from the adverse effects of flooding by prohibiting development on the lands prone to flooding. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.68.030 - Permitted uses. 
A.  Agricultural uses including general farming, pasture, grazing and related uses provided that the buildings and structures for human habitation are flood proofed; 
B.  Nonstructural uses including ponding of run-off water and treated waste water; 
C.  Public utilities including railroads, streets, channels, and pipelines; 
D.  Outdoor recreational uses including golf course, bicycle trails, picnic areas and board launching ramps. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.68.040 - Conditional uses. 
    Temporary buildings and structures not related to flood control and farming such as stands, fences, shelters, temporary signs and temporary parking. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.68.050 - Building height. 
    No building shall be more than two and one-half stories or thirty-five feet high excepting farm silos. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999) 
17.68.060 - Signs. 
    Temporary signs shall be no larger than thirty square feet in area. 
(Ord. 827 (part), 1999)
